Name: 2,4,5-TRICHLOROPHENOL
Description: 2,4,5-trichlorophenol is a trichlorophenol carrying chloro groups at positions 2, 4 and 5.

plant_concentrations.Value: 2,4,5-Trichlorophenol was detected in pine needle wax from 10-20 year old trees near pollution sources; samples were collected from three areas of Finland in 1991-1996(1):
plant_concentrations.Table: [{'Site': 'waste incinerator', 'Number samples': 5, 'Concn (ng/gdry needle)': '5-15'}, {'Site': 'metal scrap plant (1993)', 'Number samples': 6, 'Concn (ng/gdry needle)': '2-20'}, {'Site': 'metal scrap plant (1995)', 'Number samples': 6, 'Concn (ng/gdry needle)': '<1-2'}, {'Site': 'pulp and paper mill', 'Number samples': 6, 'Concn (ng/gdry needle)': '<1-2'}, {'Site': 'remote unpolluted area', 'Number samples': 1, 'Concn (ng/gdry needle)': '10'}]

animal_concentrations.Value: 2,4,5-Trichlorophenol was not detected (detection limit 1 ppb) in osprey eggs collected between 1971-1980, or in fresh muscle of white-tailed eagles collected between 1980-1982(1). However, 4% of 45 fresh muscle samples of juvenile starlings collected 1982-1983 had an average concentration of 0.067 ppb. All samples were collected in Finland(1).

animal_concentrations.References: (1) Lebedev AT et al; Sci Total Environ 212: 153-62 (1998)
animal_concentrations.Value: 2,4,5-Trichlorophenol concentrations of <5 to 132 ug/kg dry wt were detected in the birds eggs collected from the Lake Baikal region (Selenga River estuary, Russia)(1).
animal_concentrations.Table: [{'Genus species': 'Anas platyrhynchos', 'Common name': 'mallard', 'Concentration': '6'}, {'Genus species': 'Anas acuta', 'Common name': 'pintail', 'Concentration': '5'}, {'Genus species': 'Anas clypeata', 'Common name': 'shoveler', 'Concentration': '54'}, {'Genus species': 'Aythya fuligula', 'Common name': 'tufted duck', 'Concentration': '28.5'}, {'Genus species': 'Aythya ferina', 'Common name': 'pochard', 'Concentration': '10.4'}, {'Genus species': 'Anser anser', 'Common name': 'goose', 'Concentration': '<5'}, {'Genus species': 'Gallus gallus (1)', 'Common name': 'domestic fowl', 'Concentration': '7.68'}, {'Genus species': 'Gallus gallus (2)', 'Common name': 'domestic fowl', 'Concentration': '<5'}, {'Genus species': 'Ardea cinerea', 'Common name': 'heron', 'Concentration': '18.8'}, {'Genus species': 'Larus argentatus', 'Common name': 'herring gull; 2', 'Concentration': '24.4'}, {'Genus species': 'Larus canus', 'Common name': 'common gull', 'Concentration': '10.2'}, {'Genus species': 'Sterna hirundo', 'Common name': 'common tern', 'Concentration': '5'}, {'Genus species': 'Larus ridibundus', 'Common name': 'black-headed gull', 'Concentration': '132'}, {'Genus species': 'Vanellus vanellus', 'Common name': 'lapwing', 'Concentration': '<5'}, {'Genus species': 'Podiceps auritus', 'Common name': 'Slavonian grebe', 'Concentration': '13.5'}, {'Genus species': 'Tringa stagnatilis', 'Common name': 'marsh sandpiper', 'Concentration': '11.5'}]

fish_seafood_concentrations.References: (1) Kobayashi K et al; Bull Jpn Soc Sci Fish 45 (2): 173-6 (1979) (2) Herve S; Water Sci Technol 24: 397-402 (1991) (3) Paasivirta J et al; Chemosphere 14: 469-91 (1985)
fish_seafood_concentrations.Value: The concentration of chlorophenols, including 2,4,5-trichlorophenol in fish from Japan was 75-268 ug/g body weight(1). 2,4,5-Trichlorophenol was identified, not quantified, in the soft tissue of mussels in Finland(2). 2,4,5-Trichlorophenol was detected in Burbot from Lake Vitia, Finland at an average of 2.6 ppb and from salmon from Finland at an average of 1.8 ppb(3).

sediment_soil_concentrations.References: (1) Wegman RCC, Van Den Broek, HH; Wat Res 17: 227-30 (1983) (2) Eder G, Weber K; Chemosphere 9: 111-8 (1980) (3) Wegman RCC, VandenBroek HH; Water Res 17: 227-30 (1983) (4) Watanabe et al; Bull Environ Contam Toxicol 35: 272-8 (1985)
sediment_soil_concentrations.Value: SEDIMENT: 2,4,5-Trichlorophenol was detected in sediment taken from 19 sites in The Netherlands, at concentrations of <0.02-6.3 mg/kg dry wt(1). Suspended solids collected in water samples from the Weser estuary contained 2,4,5-trichlorophenol at 300-2,000 mg/L(2). 2,4,5-Trichlorophenol was detected in 17 of 17 sediment samples from Lake Ketelmeer, The Netherlands at a maximum and median concentration of 15 and 6.4 ug/kg dry wt, respectively(3). 2,4,5-Trichlorophenol was detected in the upper river and marine sediment layers in Osaka Prefecture, Japan, at <0.2-9.0 ppb dry wt(4).

sediment_soil_concentrations.References: (1) EPRI; in Pentachlorophenol (PCP) in Soils Adjacent to In-service Utility Poles in New York State. Electric Power Research Institute EPRI TR-104893 Projects 2879-09, -12, -35, 9024-02, Final Report (1995) (2) Salkinoja-Salonen MS et al; pp. 668-72 in Current Perspectives in Microbiology; Klug MJ, Reddy CA eds Nat Acad Sci (1984) (3) Kitunen V et al; Int J Environ Anal Chem 20: 13-28 (1985) (4) Valo R et al; Chemosphere 13: 835-44 (1984)
sediment_soil_concentrations.Value: SOIL: Soil samples collected around 31 wooden telephone poles located throughout New York state contained 2,4,5-trichlorophenol at not detected (detection limit 0.030 mg/kg) to 0.12 mg/kg(1). 2,4,5-Trichlorophenol concentration was 0.3 g/kg soil near a Finnish sawmill and lumber storage site at a 45 cm depth(2). 2,4,5-Trichlorophenol was detected in soil near a Finnish sawmill at 4.2, 14.2, 15.7, 5.7, 1.9 and 0.8 mg/kg wet weight at respective depths of 0-5, 5-20, 20-40, 40-50, 50-60 and 60-70 cm(3). 2,4,5-Trichlorophenol was detected in soil near the dipping pit of 2 Finnish sawmills; concentrations were 1020, 1190 and 52 ppb at respective depths of 0-5 cm, 60-80 and 120-230 cm, and 28 and 1072 ppb at depths of 0-5 and 80-100 cm(4).

sediment_soil_concentrations.References: (1) Hoekstra EJ et al; Environ Sci Technol 33: 2543-9 (1999)
sediment_soil_concentrations.Value: SOIL: Soil core samples collected from beech and Douglas fir forests in Speulderbos, The Netherlands had the following 2,4,5-trichlorophenol concentrations in ug/kg dry weight(1):
sediment_soil_concentrations.Table: [{'Depth (cm)': 'leaf litter', 'Beech': 0.22, 'Douglas fir': nan}, {'Depth (cm)': '0-5', 'Beech': 0.33, 'Douglas fir': 0.32}, {'Depth (cm)': '5-10', 'Beech': 0.2, 'Douglas fir': 0.14}, {'Depth (cm)': '10-15', 'Beech': 0.03, 'Douglas fir': 0.04}, {'Depth (cm)': '15-20', 'Beech': nan, 'Douglas fir': 0.04}]
